SENT.plain: The cavernous sinus (CS) and petrous apex (PA) are contiguous
The cavernous space and cranial nerves III and VI are intimately associated with each
To accurately interpret computed tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance (MR) images of this region, one must understand thoroughly the anatomy of the PA and CS
This article begins with a detailed review of this anatomy, followed by a discussion of pathology
Intrinsic diseases of the CS and PA are emphasized specifically
